column1: TABLE 4(KP-I)B.1.2.  SUPPLEMENTARY BACKGROUND FOR LAND USE, LAND-USE CHANGE AND FORESTRY

column11: Difference between carbon stock in the inventory year  and the carbon stock at the time of harvest(6)

column1: Parties should provide detailed explanation on the land use, land-use change and forestry sector in the relevant annex of the NIR: "Supplementary information on LULUCF activities under the Kyoto Protocol". Use this documentation box to provide references to relevant sections of the NIR if any additional details are needed to understand the content of this table.
(1)    Reporting is required in this table only by Parties that apply the provision in decision 2/CMP.7, annex, paragraphs 37-39.
(2)    Geographical location refers to the boundaries of the areas that encompass land subject to forest management.

(3)    A subcategory under the relevant  geographic location should be constructed in such a way that reported information on the harvested and converted forest plantation area and the corresponding newly established forest area can be combined.
(4)   The area of the newly established forest needs to be at least equivalent to the area of the harvested forest plantation.

(5)    The carbon stock in the newly established forested area should reach that of the harvested and converted area at the time of harvest within the normal harvesting cycle of the harvested and converted forest plantation.  If this criteria is not met, a debit should be included under the relevant category in table B.1. Additional information on the assumed growth (function) should be provided in the NIR.
(6)    This column compares the carbon stock in the newly established forest with the expected carbon stock at the time of harvest.
